headline: Occidental: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: HOUSTON (AP) — Occidental Petroleum Corp. OXY) on Wednesday reported fourth-quarter net income of $102 million. On a per-share basis, the Houston-based company said it had net loss of 7 cents.

headline: Occidental Announces Fourth Quarter 2025 Results
summary: HOUSTON, Feb. 18, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Occidental (NYSE: OXY) today announced its fourth quarter 2025 financial results. The earnings release and accompanying financial schedules can be accessed via the Investor Relations section of the company’s website at oxy.com. The earnings release is also available on the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission’s website at sec.gov. The company will hold a conference call to discuss the results on Thursday, February 19, 2026, at 1 p.m. Eastern/12 p.m.

headline: Occidental Refocuses After US$9.7b OxyChem Sale To Berkshire Hathaway
summary: Occidental Petroleum (NYSE:OXY) is selling its OxyChem unit to Berkshire Hathaway in a US$9.7b cash deal. The transaction represents a major reshaping of Occidental's portfolio toward oil, gas and low carbon ventures. Proceeds are earmarked for debt reduction and increased investment in carbon capture and carbon negative projects. For investors, this move centers Occidental more firmly on its core upstream oil and gas business while creating additional room for low carbon initiatives. The...

headline: Susquehanna Lowers Occidental Petroleum (OXY) PT Amid Near-Term Oil Oversupply Concerns
summary: Occidental Petroleum Corporation (NYSE:OXY) is one of the best stocks under $50 to invest in. On January 26, Susquehanna analyst Charles Minervino lowered the firm’s price target on Occidental to $51 from $55 while keeping a Positive rating. This decision was made as part of the firm’s Q4 2025 exploration and production group preview. Minervino […]

headline: Occidental earnings, FOMC minutes, housing data: What to Watch
summary: Asking for a Trend Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Wednesday, February 18, including Carvana (CVNA), Occidental Petroleum (OXY), and Booking Holdings (BKNG); the minutes from the Federal Reserve's January FOMC meeting; and the latest data on US housing starts and building permits. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.
